chargeHist.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
The defendant Orlando Aviles Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges by 12-15-2016 or a civil judgment to be entered WITH tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for THREE (3) days served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law, upon submission of motion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Orlando Aviles Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Orlando Aviles in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

On motion of the state, the court amended the charge to Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 946.41(1), a class A Misdemeanor.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

Court sentenced defendant to serve THREE (3) DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for THREE (3) days served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges by 12-15-2016 or a civil judgment to be entered WITH tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law, upon submission of motion.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.
Fokus Family Service progress report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Orlando Aviles in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Court reviewed Fokus progress report.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Orlando Aviles in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.    All parties notified, effective August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Carl Ashley, Branch 33, in room 113 in the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Review hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Orlando Aviles in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Off record

Defense request for a plea date for a DPA is approved.  Case is adjourned for DPA hearing in Branch 22  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for 06-22-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Orlando Aviles in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Patrick Anderson for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 03/23/2015

Court ordered the remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered Absolute Sobriety.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Orlando Aviles in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Ann R. Lpez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/26/15 @ 1:30pm
